summary: The Law Enforcement Officers Equity Act aims to amend federal law regarding retirement benefits for law enforcement officers. It expands the definition of “law enforcement officer” under the Federal Employees Retirement System (FERS) and Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS) to include specific positions, such as certain IRS employees, Postal Inspection Service employees, Veterans Affairs police officers, and seized property specialists at Customs and Border Protection. The bill also addresses how current law enforcement officers (incumbents) can retroactively receive these benefits. This includes provisions for making contributions for prior service and government contributions.
